definition: Brooklyn, borough of New York City
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)

pinyin: Bu4 lu3 ke4 lin2 Da4 qiao2

sentences.english: I went to elementary school and high school in Brooklyn.
sentences.chinese: 我在布魯克林念得初中和高中。

sentences.english: So are you planning to spend the summer sweating it out in Brooklyn?
sentences.chinese: 那你的暑假就準備在布魯克林苦熬嘍？

sentences.english: The Brooklyn Bridge is one of the oldest suspension bridges in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 布魯克林大橋時美國最古老的吊橋之一。

sentences.english: Then, how would you describe people in Brooklyn?
sentences.chinese: 那你會怎麼描述布魯克林人呢？

sentences.english: The bridge from Brooklyn to Staten Island is the longest in the world.
sentences.chinese: 從布魯克林斯臺登島經過的大橋是世界上最長的橋。

sentences.english: they have to be very specific because Brooklyn is enormous.
sentences.chinese: 他們要說得很具體纔行，因爲布魯克林很大。

sentences.english: there're 4 million people living in Brooklyn by itself.
sentences.chinese: 在布魯克林住着四百萬人口。

sentences.english: The southbound A trains say Brooklyn.
sentences.chinese: 往南開的A列地鐵上寫着“布魯克林”。

sentences.english: Every month or so I'd take the subway and go visit him in Brooklyn.
sentences.chinese: 每過一個月左右我都會搭地鐵去布魯克林區見他。

sentences.english: Bessler moves himself and his family from Weissenstein Castle to Karlshafen.
sentences.chinese: 老婆的舉動自己和家人從布魯克林城堡卡爾斯哈芬。

sentences.english: but Brooklyn is just monstrous in size. It goes, god,
sentences.chinese: 但布魯克林的規模更大。那兒有，我的天啊，

sentences.english: Just another Saturday in Brooklyn, whatever.
sentences.chinese: 無論怎樣，這就是布魯克林的週六。

sentences.english: Judy in Brooklyn, are you up?
sentences.chinese: 布魯克林的朱迪，你醒了嗎？

sentences.english: These pillows allow you to recreate a Brooklyn street in your home.
sentences.chinese: 這些枕頭能讓你在自己家裏再造出一條布魯克林大街。

sentences.english: Remember, I have to go over to Brooklyn yet to-night.
sentences.chinese: 請記着，今天晚上我還得趕到布魯克林去。

sentences.english: Brooklyn is probably just as popular to live as Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 住在布魯克林可能和曼哈頓一樣受歡迎。

definition: to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)

pinyin: Jia1 li4 fu2 ni2 ya4 zhou1
